meanings.definition: In a dowdy manner; shabbily or unfashionably dressed.
meanings.sent1: She walked dowdily to the party in her old, faded dress.
meanings.sent2: The man dressed dowdily in mismatched clothes.
meanings.sent3: Despite her efforts, she always ended up looking dowdily dressed.
meanings.sent4: The room was decorated so dowdily that it seemed stuck in a time warp.
meanings.sent5: The old scarecrow stood dowdily in the field, its clothes tattered and worn.

meanings.definition: In a dull or unattractive way.
meanings.sent1: The painting was displayed dowdily in the dimly lit gallery.
meanings.sent2: The movie ended dowdily, leaving the audience disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations were put up dowdily, lacking any sparkle.
meanings.sent4: Her voice sounded dowdily over the crackling phone line.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant garden now bloomed dowdily, its colors faded with time.
